ticket.title: ActiveRecord - named_scope using ':columns' as the name is buggered
ticket.original-body-html:
I spent all afternoon on this one but it's rewarding to find it....

Given a model called "Article"

I have a list of named_scope directives as follows:

  named_scope :active,  :conditions => {:active     => true}
  named_scope :journal, :conditions => {:department => 0}
  named_scope :features,:conditions => {:department => 1}
  # NOTE: If you use :columns here, it's buggered!
  named_scope :column,  :conditions => {:department => 2}
  named_scope :news,    :conditions => {:department => 3}
  named_scope :tips,    :conditions => {:department => 4}

If I use :column for a name, it works fine. If I use :columns for a name the model's attributes are not accessible in script/console or when rails is running normally.

-Art

version.body-html:
I spent all afternoon on this one but it's rewarding to find it....

Given a model called "Article"

I have a list of named_scope directives as follows:

  named_scope :active,  :conditions => {:active     => true}
  named_scope :journal, :conditions => {:department => 0}
  named_scope :features,:conditions => {:department => 1}
  # NOTE: If you use :columns here, it's buggered!
  named_scope :column,  :conditions => {:department => 2}
  named_scope :news,    :conditions => {:department => 3}
  named_scope :tips,    :conditions => {:department => 4}

If I use :column for a name, it works fine. If I use :columns for a name the model's attributes are not accessible in script/console or when rails is running normally.

-Art
version.title: ActiveRecord - named_scope using ':columns' as the name is buggered

version.body: columns is a reserved class method on ActiveRecord. Perhaps named_scope should error if you try to define a method that is already defined?
version.body-html: columns is a reserved class method on ActiveRecord. Perhaps named_scope should error if you try to define a method that is already defined?
version.title: ActiveRecord - named_scope using ':columns' as the name is buggered

version.body: In edge Rails you will be warned if defining a scope results in a method being overridden. This ticket can be closed.
version.body-html: In edge Rails you will be warned if defining a scope results in a method being overridden. This ticket can be closed.
version.title: ActiveRecord - named_scope using ':columns' as the name is buggered

version.body:
[Fixed in edge Rails](http://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/named_scope.rb#L89-92):
if !scopes[name] && respond_to?(name, true) logger.warn "Creating scope :#{name}. " \ "Overwriting existing method #{self.name}.#{name}." end
version.body-html:
Fixed in edge Rails:

    if !scopes[name] && respond_to?(name, true)
      logger.warn "Creating scope :#{name}. " \
                  "Overwriting existing method #{self.name}.#{name}."
    end
